text: [Music]
meatbox is under Fire as new complaints
emerge its facial recognition technology
fails to identify black people critics
say a lack of diversity on the
engineering team may have contributed to
the issue and with public pressure
growing meatbox founder Mick Morton has
promised sweeping internal changes
[Music]
aoy aoy
aoy when I dropped out of Harvard to
build meat box in my parents' garage I
remember thinking I hope they don't pull
the car
[Laughter]
in I also remember thinking meatbox had
to be a platform for
everybody now in the next few days
you're going to hear the media claim
that we have failed at that you're going
to hear outlandish accusations mix
biased Mick's a racist Mick hates the
entire nation of Ghana well that's not
me it's not who we are we are the same
company that last quarter alone
partnered with 22 blackowned vendors we
are the same company that during the
George Floyd protests suspended
operations for 12 hours we're the same
company whose Flagship office has a
world Cuisine station dedicated to the
food of the Caribbean and occasionally
Africa it's it's diverse it's different
it's yummy we like it that's who we
are but to make it Crystal Clear who we
are I am thrilled to announce that in
the next 30 days we are relaunching the
meatbox brand at a companywide
presentation our top design team will
pitch a meatbox makeover we're going to
have a new logo a new slogan and a new
commitment to the exact same values that
got us here
he's incredible
